feed.title: Lareau Lab
feed.subtitle: The Lareau Laboratory for Computational and Systems Immunology is in the csBio Program at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, New York, NY.

entry.title: New grant support!
entry.content: The lab receives an Notice of Award from the National Cancer Institute’s IMAT Program for advanced development of nucleic acid cytometry!
entry.summary: The lab receives an Notice of Award from the National Cancer Institute’s IMAT Program for advanced development of nucleic acid cytometry!

entry.title: 100 mile run!
entry.content: Paul, Cole and Caleb conquer the Badger 101.1 mile trail race! Check out these exhausted but ecstatic finishers!!.
entry.summary: Paul, Cole and Caleb conquer the Badger 101.1 mile trail race! Check out these exhausted but ecstatic finishers!!.

entry.title: New papers online!
entry.content: A flurry of papers are now out this month! Out now in PNAS, our characterization of purifying selection in a mtDNA synonymous allele is published. Check out the fun backstory here. Next, a preprint with the Dhindsa Lab @BCM studying Epstein-Barr virus using population sequencing is out on bioRxiv. Finally, a collaboration with the Satpathy lab is available on bioRxiv now! Congratulations to Sherry, Erin, Jacob, Benan, Meghana, Thahmina, and Laura for their huge contributions to these works spanning mitochondrial genetics, cancer biology, and viral persistence!
entry.summary: A flurry of papers are now out this month! Out now in PNAS, our characterization of purifying selection in a mtDNA synonymous allele is published. Check out the fun backstory here. Next, a preprint with the Dhindsa Lab @BCM studying Epstein-Barr virus using population sequencing is out on bioRxiv. Finally, a collaboration with the Satpathy lab is available on bioRxiv now! Congratulations to Sherry, Erin, Jacob, Benan, Meghana, Thahmina, and Laura for their huge contributions to these works spanning mitochondrial genetics, cancer biology, and viral persistence!

entry.title: Cornell Protein Science Symposium!
entry.content: Many members of the lab travel to Cornell @ Ithaca for the Protein Science Symposium! Congratulations to Laura for being selected to give a talk on exciting new proteo-genomics work coming from the lab!
entry.summary: Many members of the lab travel to Cornell @ Ithaca for the Protein Science Symposium! Congratulations to Laura for being selected to give a talk on exciting new proteo-genomics work coming from the lab!

entry.title: High school STEM night!
entry.content: The lab attends the NYSCI Teen & STEM night! Located at the New York Hall of Science, the STEM career night brought in >500 local high school students to learn more about careers in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Our lab represented MSKCC, and our team shared about how AI enables new careers and potentially new cancer therapies! Thanks to Betty, Arthur, Benan, Zeyu, and Hoyin for spending their Friday night with a bunch of high schoolers!
entry.summary: The lab attends the NYSCI Teen & STEM night! Located at the New York Hall of Science, the STEM career night brought in >500 local high school students to learn more about careers in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Our lab represented MSKCC, and our team shared about how AI enables new careers and potentially new cancer therapies! Thanks to Betty, Arthur, Benan, Zeyu, and Hoyin for spending their Friday night with a bunch of high schoolers!

entry.title: Caleb gives seminar at OMRF!
entry.content: Caleb had a scientific homecoming! After getting his start in science in 2011 as a Fleming Scholar at Oklahoma Medical Research Foundation, he was invited back as part of the Presidential Seminar Series.
entry.summary: Caleb had a scientific homecoming! After getting his start in science in 2011 as a Fleming Scholar at Oklahoma Medical Research Foundation, he was invited back as part of the Presidential Seminar Series.

entry.title: HHV6 meeting in Japan!
entry.content: Caleb and Erin attend the 12th International Conference on HHV-6 and HHV-7 in Himeji, Japan. Congratulations to Erin for winning a best trainee abstract award!
entry.summary: Caleb and Erin attend the 12th International Conference on HHV-6 and HHV-7 in Himeji, Japan. Congratulations to Erin for winning a best trainee abstract award!

entry.title: Caleb is awarded the Michelson prize!

link.title: Caleb is awarded the Michelson prize!

entry.content: Caleb is one of three winners of the Michelson Prize in Systems Immunology. This award will directly fund our research on the evolving blood virome and its impact on human disease. Thank you to the Human Immunome Project and Michelson Medical Research Foundation for this amazing honor! Read more about the awardees here.
entry.summary: Caleb is one of three winners of the Michelson Prize in Systems Immunology. This award will directly fund our research on the evolving blood virome and its impact on human disease. Thank you to the Human Immunome Project and Michelson Medical Research Foundation for this amazing honor! Read more about the awardees here.

entry.title: The Lab’s work on the virome is highlighted!

link.title: The Lab’s work on the virome is highlighted!

entry.content: Erin and Caleb sat down with our colleague Ian Demsky to discuss the lab’s on going work to study the human virome. This includes highlighting our new U01 grant to study the virome comprehensively using large datasets. Check out the full story here!
entry.summary: Erin and Caleb sat down with our colleague Ian Demsky to discuss the lab’s on going work to study the human virome. This includes highlighting our new U01 grant to study the virome comprehensively using large datasets. Check out the full story here!

entry.title: PERFF-seq out in Nature Genetics!
entry.content: The finalized manuscript describing PERFF-seq is online today in Nature Genetics. A PDF is available here. Congrats Tsion, Benan, and all of our wonderful collaborators! Check out our landing page on PERFF-seq here and the Nature Genetics News and Views from the Shaffer Lab here.
